title: Little Rock Central High School National Historic Site: Find Your Park Poetry Workshop
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     Photos & Multimedia     Find Your Park Poetry Workshop              Find Your Park Poetry Workshop       Little Rock Central High School and the National Park Service held a poetry workshop asking students to find, explore, and connect with a National Park Site they had not been to. The students then wrote and recorded a 90 second piece of spoken word personifying the park's resources. These are the videos that were produced from the workshop.                        Liftoff David was asked to explore Wright Brothers National Memorial and Tuskegee Airman National Historic Site through digital, online resources and produce a 90 second spoken word piece personifying the park resources.  Duration:2 minutes, 23 seconds                                A Very Unique Kind Norel was asked to explore Redwood National and State Parks through digital, online resources and produce a 90 second spoken word piece personifying the park resources.  Duration:1 minute, 53 seconds                                Over the Peak Jamese was asked to explore Wrangle-St. Elias National Park and Preserve through digital, online resources and produce a 90 second spoken word piece personifying the park resources.  Duration:1 minute, 40 seconds
